item.title: Introducing sessiond
item.description: When I began using Linux on the desktop in ~2012, I experimented with the prevalent desktop environments (Gnome, KDE, etc.), but was quickly drawn into the realm of tiling window managers by their promise of increased productivity and customization. While I believe these promises were fulfilled, tiling window managers were not without a significant shortcoming: they are solely window managers, lacking the integrated suite of software and applications that put the environment in desktop environments.
